title: Tesco mocked after stocking condoms in children's health section of store
text:
Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments STUNNED parents were left rubbing their eyes after Durex condoms were spotted in the children’s health section of Tesco. 
The rubbers were stacked in theft-proof plastic boxes on a shelf above Calpol baby medicine. The condoms were lined up neatly above a range of child healthcare products 
Gobsmacked shopper Shiri Kraus posted an image of the mishap on Facebook and added: “Nice one, Tesco”. 
A spokesperson for the supermarket chain responded: “I’m sorry about the inappropriate products on the children’s health aisle. related stories 'this must be what heaven tastes like' Tesco are now selling whole boxes of Maltesers Teasers… and people are freaking out IN HOT WATER Taxi driver suing Tesco after coffee flask 'exploded' in her hands causing first-degree burns SUPERMARKET SWEEP Tesco to buy Budgens and Londis owner Booker in £3.7bn deal to create 'UK's leading food business' SUPERMARKET SWEEP Tesco shoppers can use their phone to pay for shopping (and newbies get £20 worth of Clubcard points) BUM DEAL Have Tesco been caught short by eagle-eyed customers? Shoppers claim Luxury Soft Toilet Tissue is now smaller because of a bigger cardboard middle KIND COPPER Kind-hearted policeman blags KFC meals and Tesco groceries for homeless men living under M62 bridge 
“I’d really like to look into this and alert my colleagues. Can you please tell me at which store you saw this?” 
The condoms were spotted in a Tesco Extra convenience store in Conley Hatch Lane, Muswell Hill, London. 
The Sun has contacted Tesco for a comment. Robbie Williams and comedian Alan Carr's film sketch in Tesco supermarket 
Tesco have also been accused of giving customers a bum deal by reducing the size of its toilet rolls. 
Last week it emerged the supermarkert giant has bought the Booker Group - the UK's biggest food wholesaler. 
A customer has shared images of her injuries after a Pyrex glass dish she bought in Tesco exploded
